text: we affirm the stormtroopers this is
megan speciai video journalist with the
New York Times reporting from Charlotte
North Carolina myself and my colleague
Erica Baron seen arrived in Charlotte to
cover the protests that are going on in
the city in the aftermath of the police
shooting of Keith Scott he is a black
man who was shot and killed by police
outside of his apartment complex earlier
this week we were walking with a young
couple and three young boys ages 7 8 and
9 talking to them about why they were
here and what they were protesting and
as we approached the Omni Hotel I heard
what sounded like gunshots
as soon as the banks went off a huge
crowd of people who had been standing in
front of the Omni Hotel sort of facing
off with police began running towards us
and running away from the entrance of
the Omni as I got closer I saw that
there was a young man lying on the
ground he was bleeding profusely
motionless and people were crowding
around him trying to help trying to see
him try to take pictures of him
some emergency personnel came and they
removed him from the scene
they took him behind a line of police
that were barricading the door and at
that point a lot of people sort of
chased them towards the police and
started yelling at the police and some
people were throwing punches the police
were shoving people people were throwing
potted plants at the police there was
dirt flying everywhere and at that point
they were throwing some I don't know
what it was but they were throwing a red
substance that at that point I got in my
eyes and all over my camera and
unfortunately I wasn't able to see what
happened after that it was pretty hectic
scene for a while
after a night of tension in Charlotte
the National Guard was called in and a
state of emergency was declared in the
city but residents that we spoke to
describe feelings sadness and fear about
the violence going on in their city
Oh
